title: Negative attitude bans.
body:
Can we get some super strict rules in game for attitude.

I'm a sensitive little flower and when people talk ♥♥♥♥ it ruins games for me and I stop caring about trying.

I don't care if I'm winning, I give up.

The amount of toxicity I see is not acceptable.

qq cry qq

replies.body:
This is always an interesting discussion to have especially because less than 1% of players are persistently negative enough to trigger a major punishment such as a 14-day ban or permanent ban. The toxicity you see is usually a player that 90% of the time is neutral - positive in their behaviour BUT they have that **one** bad day. Sometimes this is compounded because multiple players have that **one** bad game/day in the same game.

Our approach to deal with players like this is to first try and reform them. If you're interested in player behaviour please check out the following links! The GDCvault link is especially interesting.

http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/exploring-player-behavior-design-values

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/player-behavior-design-values-reform

http://gdcvault.com/play/1017940/The-Science-Behind-Shaping-Player

Personally i just talk logic back to them all day. Even if they abuse me.

You don't get to choose just your definition of good, the bad comes along with it, deal with it.

It's easy mate.
I have cross chat off at all times. I don't care what the other team has to say mostly because it's generally abuse.
The instant someone on my team says anything negative I mute them. I don't have time to listen to whingers, people that get cranky about a game etc.
Ive got quite a list of muted people now. I would say every second game I play I have someone that was previously muted and I have found a lot less toxicity in my games as a result.
My games are mostly chat free in fact since 99% of chat in this game is rage and abuse. Rule those players out and it's a ghost town.
